com.esri.mo2.ui.dnd
Interface DndHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseDndHandler
public interface DndHandler

The DndHandler interface is to define a generic way to handle the operations of draging a data type and droping it on the Map component or a component referencing Map object in the MapObject Java. The class implementing the interface or extending from the BaseDndHandler class can be registered in the DndManager which operates the the process of drag & drop. Dependent upon the data type in the transferable object, the DndManager will search the registered DndHandler(s) to find the right one to deal with the data type to complete the drag & drop cycle.

Method Detail

getTransferable

public Transferable getTransferable(DragGestureEvent e)
The method will be called to create an transferable object before starting the drag. A componenet as drag source should provide detail implementation for the method. The drag process will not be triggered it return a null.

Parameters:
e - a java.awt.dnd.DragGestureEvent object.
Returns:
a java.awt.dataTransfer.Transferable object.

handleDrop

public void handleDrop(Transferable transferable,
                       DropTargetDropEvent event)
                throws Exception
The method will be executed while a transferable data is dropped into a drop target. If the DndHandler is registerred in the component as the drop target, the method should be correctly implemented to complete the Drag and Drop process.

Parameters:
transferable - - java.awt.dataTransfer.Transferable object.
event - - a DropTargetDropEvent event
Throws:
Exception - - throw a Exception when the drop is rejected.

getSupportedDataFlavors

public DataFlavor[] getSupportedDataFlavors()
Obtains a supported DataFlavor arrays.

Returns:
- A supported DataFlavor array objects.

isTransferableSupported

public boolean isTransferableSupported(Transferable t)
To see if the transferable object is supported.

Parameters:
t - - a java.awt.dataTransfer.Transferable object.
Returns:
- returns true if the given transferable object is supported in the DnD.

getDragCursor

public Cursor getDragCursor()
Gets a Cursor object used for drag cursor, it returns a null object, the default drag cursor will be applied.

Returns:
a java.awt.Cursor object.
